node.title: New Zealand Opposition Leader ousted hours after demoting rival
node.description: A year after suffering a huge election loss, New Zealand's conservative Opposition Leader Judith Collins is ousted by her colleagues.

node.title: 'Huge milestone' as Danny Hodgson leaves ICU, but long, 'gruelling' road to recovery still ahead
node.description: Perth soccer player Danny Hodgson is moved out of the intensive care unit at Royal Perth Hospital almost three months after he was attacked on a night out.

node.title: 'Don't rely on social media' - DHB debunks anti-vax illness rumours
node.description: Northland DHB's chief executive is dispelling rumours spread by anti-vaxxers he has had a severe heart attack after a Covid-19 vaccination.

node.title: Seth Meyers Skewers Subpoenaed Trump Cronies
node.description: “It’s also important to remember these people only hang out with each other because there is no one else who will hang out with them,” Meyers said.

node.title: Watch: Dr Shane Reti speaks as National's new interim leader
node.description: Judith Collins was forced to step down after her caucus issued a motion of no confidence in her, interim leader Dr Shane Reti has confirmed. Watch his first press conference as leader here.

node.title: Marlborough District Council subsidises local airline fares
node.description: Pelorus Air is the latest transport operator connecting Marlborough Sounds residents, business owners, tradespeople, essential services and visitors cut off by the by the July storm.

node.title: Tackling lockdown locks: 'There's a lot of hair on the floor'
node.description: Auckland hairdressers and barbers are among the first businesses to trial the new Covid-19 vaccination passes before the rest of the country joins in next Friday. Audio

node.title: Simon Bridges: 'It was a very poor process from Judith Collins'
node.description: National MP Simon Bridges spoke out about allegations against him that led to the end of Judith Collins' tenure as leader, and not ruling out taking another tilt at the leadership.

node.title: 'Corporate welfare': Push back over proposals that would reduce emissions by 1pc
node.description: There is growing pushback at a proposal to price agricultural climate gases, with the 1 percent emissions reduction being labelled "ridiculous".

node.title: 'Hello, conspiracy theorists. Please, get a life': NT chief's big swipe at 'international trolls' spreading COVID-19 misinformation
node.description: The Northern Territory Chief Minister has delivered a spray against "tinfoil hat-wearing tossers sitting in their parent's basement" who he says are spreading conspiracy theories about the Territory's current COVID-19 outbreak.

node.title: Australia to send troops and police to Solomon Islands amid unrest
node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says Australian troops and police will be sent to Solomon Islands to help stabilise the island nation amid growing violence and unrest.

node.title: The Penknife: A Thanksgiving Memory
node.description: Eating had become a chore for my parents, but I was determined to make a feast. I had never given much thought to Dad’s penknife until that meal.

node.title: Usman Khawaja's captaincy may cost him an Ashes spot after Travis Head tons up
node.description: Queensland captain Usman Khawaja hands Travis Head another opportunity to prove his worth for a spot in the first Test team by enforcing the follow-on in the Sheffield Shield clash with South Australia.

node.title: AFL draft continues with clubs ready to pounce on bargains — join the discussion
node.description: After some surprises on night one, the AFL draft continues with a number of highly regarded players still on the board. Follow every pick in our live blog.

node.title: The Melbourne man who took on the Catholic Church over historical sexual abuse and won
node.description: A Melbourne man has been awarded a record settlement by the Catholic Church of $3.7 million for historical sexual abuse, after the Archdiocese of Melbourne admitted a former Archbishop breached his duty of care.

node.title: Energy Minister Dan van Holst Pellekaan unveiled as SA's new Deputy Premier
node.description: Dan van Holst Pellekaan is officially South Australia's new Deputy Premier, after a vote of Lower House Liberal MPs this afternoon.

node.title: United Nations calls for immediate end to fighting in Ethiopia
node.description: UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres is calling for an end to fighting in Ethiopia, during his visit to Colombia's capital Bogota.

node.title: Solomon Islands Riots: What’s Behind the Protests?
node.description: Discontent has long simmered over a perceived unequal distribution of resources and the central government’s decision to switch allegiances to China from Taiwan.

node.title: Australian farmers just as productive with borders closed, study finds
node.description: New data shows Australia's fruit and vegetable grower output remained steady despite border closures reducing worker numbers.

node.title: Russian military warns debris from one of its rockets could fall into Tasmanian waters
node.description: A blunt warning from the Russian military that rocket debris may fall close to Tasmania came as quite the surprise to the island's aviation industry, with one pilot saying it made a change from the usual messages about "boring things, like the runway is closed because it's wet".

node.title: Collins may be gone but NZ's search for a credible, viable opposition is not over
node.description: Analysis: When Shane Reti replaced Judith Collins at the helm of New Zealand's National Party today, he became the fifth National leader Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has faced.

node.title: New Swedish PM resigns on first day in job
node.description: Social Democrat Magdalena Andersson resigned after less than 12 hours in the top job after the Green Party quit their two-party coalition, stoking political uncertainty.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 178 new community cases today, one more death
node.description: The Ministry of Health is also reporting that there are 77 people in hospital, including eight people in ICU.

node.title: Scattered, Broke Defendants Make Collecting $26M 'Unite The Right' Settlement Difficult
node.description: Richard Spencer, one of the most famous white nationalists credited with popularizing the term "alt-right," called the lawsuit "financially crippling."

node.title: Vaccination Proof Required For Visitors, Not Lawmakers, in New Mexico's Capitol Building
node.description: Vaccinated individuals would be able to go to legislative hearings starting in January, a first since the pandemic started.

node.title: Gunshots allegedly fired in remote NT community
node.description: Police are responding to reports of serious unrest and gunshots being fired in the community of Peppimenarti, south-west of Darwin, which has been struggling with reports of violence for months.

node.title: Official cash rate hike 'just another blow' for first-time home buyers
node.description: Yesterday's rise in the official cash rate is being described as a kick in the guts for first home buyers.

node.title: Will India put the Black Caps in a spin?
node.description: The Black Caps are bracing for a trial by spin in their two-test series against India but the world champions are excited to face the acid test.

node.title: 'Kiwis deserve more' - probe finds power cuts on freezing night unnecessary
node.description: There was no need for power cuts that left 34,000 households without electricity on one of the coldest nights of the year, an inquiry finds.

node.title: A New Hall of Fame Ballot Is a Chance to Remember
node.description: A great deal of ink will be spilled on the candidacies of Alex Rodriguez and David Ortiz. For a moment, stop to consider the 11 other new candidates instead.
